channel.title: Government Shutdown (US)
channel.description: Only an hour before the government "shuts down." Are you guys ready?! :P

item.title: Government Shutdown (US)
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

They came up with a last minute budget as they have been doing for the past few months; all that will do is extend the time they have to create a secured budget before a real shut down.

And I do realize this is nothing big - notice I put the words “shuts down” in quotation marks?

Read full topic

item.title: Government Shutdown (US)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

The reason our government has so many members is because it has to represent over 200 million people and actually let the majority have an effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Government Shutdown (US)
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

Loveandpower:

@jmood, the government already break the constitution every day I don’t think decreasing Congress would really make a row…

Less people in government makes government less democratic, the US has relatively small houses as it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Government Shutdown (US)
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:35, topic:390116”][quote author=mark033 link=topic=486029.msg3561971#msg3561971 date=1302352384]

Ah, but you don’t get where I am aiming at, you see there are already a vast amount of representatives and senators, cut it into two.

Ah, but you obviously don’t know what Ben was talking about.

There’s a reason most stable governments have two houses.
[/quote]( Off topic: sorry guys I can get so political lol…really should make a rants section xD)

I never said it couldn’t be stable…there can be two houses but with less people. Why do we need two senators for each state, why do we need so many representatives for each state? Absolutely unneeded.[/quote]

Maybe because it says so in our constitution?

http://www.senate.gov/artandhistory/history/common/briefing/Constitution_Senate.htm

Read full topic

item.title: Government Shutdown (US)
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

woosh

Why not just have 5 people that make decisions? That’s really easy and you wouldn’t have to pay shit compared to now.

Read full topic

item.title: Government Shutdown (US)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Theres your hope and change

A government shutdown is when all “non essential” government employees are laid off, which will be about 800,000 people.

Read full topic

item.title: Government Shutdown (US)
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:27, topic:390116”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=486029.msg3561764#msg3561764 date=1302323676]

[quote author=krackkid link=topic=486029.msg3561762#msg3561762 date=1302323639]

Guys it seems they come to a agreement so this is not going to happen. I am sorry to make you all sad.

They came to an agreement? They only had until midnight…
Ah well, what ever.
[/quote]well they been working on it all week. So I guess instead of losing there jobs they just did it.

Probably the smarter idea.
[/quote]How do you see that, less congressman to pay = more money for America.[/quote]

Less congressmen = less democracy. Didn’t Ben Franklin say something about that?

Read full topic
